Documentation

11ty Website

Info

This project uses the static site generator 11ty and the templating engine handlebars to generate html pages. It also uses strapi for headless cms. All the markdown is stored in strapi and the way to access it is by typing npm run develop in the terminal which will make you access the strapi website. I have 3 files which pull info from strapi they are grabmd.js, images.js and blog.js. blog and grabmd both grab info from strapi via rest api. That data is then placed through a filter in eleventy.config.js where the md is turned into html so the pages 11ty generates can display the given information. images.js just pulls images from strapi via restapi. All the files mentioned so far except for the config file are in the _data folder so whatever info they pull from strapi will act as global data in llty.

Installation

In order for this to run you need to install node.js 11ty and handlebars

Maintenance

General Guidelines

Content Management:

  • Use Strapi to manage all Markdown files and images.
  • Organize content logically using collections in Strapi.
  • Regularly backup the Strapi database to prevent data loss.

Dependencies:

  • Keep dependencies up-to-date by running:

  • npm outdated

  • npm update

Adding New Features:

New Content Type:

  • Define a new content type in Strapi.
  • Create a corresponding data-fetching script in the _data folder.
  • Add templates or partials to display the new data.

Extending Functionality:

  • Use the eleventy.config.js file to register new filters, shortcodes, or plugins as needed.
  • Test any changes locally before deploying.
